definition: to think over
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge

sentences.english: Hence, sometimes I try to figure out myself through horoscopes, zodiacs, etc by hoping they can help me in understanding myself.
sentences.chinese: 所以，有時會通過星座生肖等，去推敲自己的性格。

sentences.english: They went through the details of the plan over and over again to make sure that there was no possibility of failure.
sentences.chinese: 爲了保證不出岔子，他們把計劃的細節反覆作了推敲。

sentences.english: We should reconsider it and weight the wording.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該對此條重新考慮，推敲一下措詞。

sentences.english: He turned the matter over in his mind slowly and deliberately .
sentences.chinese: 他把這問題在心上慢慢地審慎地反覆推敲。

sentences.english: He hashed a phrase in order to colour the sentence.
sentences.chinese: 他反覆推敲一個習語以使該句增色。

sentences.english: Good writers usually strike a balance between revising and completion.
sentences.chinese: 優秀的作家總在成稿之前反覆推敲。

sentences.english: Therefore own look up, deliberates is very good.
sentences.chinese: 所以自己多查，多推敲是很好的。

sentences.english: Second-guessing is what gets in the way of a writer’s ability to write faster.
sentences.chinese: “推敲”是阻礙作者寫得更快的絆腳石。

sentences.english: Game has gone, who will care about weigh and a plate of CanQi in addition to the world of mortals?
sentences.chinese: 對弈的人已走，誰還在意推敲紅塵之外的一盤殘棋？

sentences.english: But the growing scrutiny of the village guard system is fueling calls for its disbandment.
sentences.chinese: 但是對衛隊體系的不斷推敲更助長了要求解散的聲音。

sentences.english: The West has no grounds to monopolize the rights of speech in terms of human rights.
sentences.chinese: 西方國家的人權話語壟斷是完全經不起推敲的。

definition: to analyze/to try to figure out/to try to fathom
to consider/to deliberate/to fill up a cup to the brim
to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
weighing every word
to study/to examine/to probe/to study the underlying principles
to design/to plot/to plan out/to compose/to draw a mental sketch/conception/plan/idea/composition
to study attentively (a book)/to delve into
to look into (a matter)
(dialect) to savor/to test the taste of/(fig.) to ponder upon/to mull over
to discuss/to bring up various ideas for discussion
to perform an in-depth investigation
add and delete
careful thought
to be able to withstand/to be able to endure
literal/word by word and phrase by phrase
words/expressions/writing
